column4: Hello all I am a newbie that needs someone to take pity on me and help me mount a floppy drive.  I keep screwing something up.
i think it auto mounts it in /media/floppy
sudo mount /dev/fd /mnt/floppy , assuming its on that
I just installed 6.01 a few weeks ago.
when you try and mount the floppy do u get an erro?
/media/floppy, if that directory doesnt exist you will have to make it
you can name it whatever you want thats just the mount directory the /dev/fd0 depends on how many like paddy asked
if floppy0 is already present in /media then go ahead and run mount /dev/fd0 /media/floppy0
mount -t vfat /dev/fd0 /media/floppy0 if that dont work try msdos
that would be a good idea
maybe, not a big gui fan, if not just open up filebrowser and go to /media/floppy0
you can try googling automount floppy
there you go IcemanV9, you can write scripts to make your life easier
i think you have to due to the nature of it
you shouldnt need the sudo actually
i think the entry is in your fstab all you have to do is mount /dev/fd0 and it should mount it there
u can hit the button any time , but if you have stuff that you wanted to write to it , then it might not get wrote unless u umount first
